result.execSummary:
The defendant Taza TC Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taza TC Carter

records.addlTxt:
(Cases called at 11:17 AM - 20CF1239, 22CF431, 22CM307)
Defendant Taza TC Carter appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared by video (on 20CF1239) with Attorney Robert Thorson (on 22CF431 and 22CM307).  Attorney Trenton Piltz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin by video.
Defendant waives right to personal appearance.  State outlines agreement as to the probation revocation sentence and as to the new cases.  Parties make statements as to the probation revocation sentence.  Court orders 9 months of jail on each count in 20CF1239, concurrent to each other, with 201 days of credit.  Attorney Hillestad leaves the hearing.  Defendant acknowledges Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form.  Defendant advised of his Constitutional rights, as well as the elements and maximum possible penalties of the offenses to which he will plead. Court finds Defendant guilty based on pleas of No Contest to 22CM307 Count 2: Misdemeanor Battery (with Domestic, WITHOUTRepeater), and 22CF431 Count 1: Armed Robbery (Party to a Crime, WITHOUT Repeater) and Count 3: Substantial Battery (Party to a Crime, WITHOUT Repeater).  Parties provide comments regarding the agreement.  Defendant makes a statement. 
As to 22CM307, Court orders court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  As to 22CF431 Count 3, Court orders court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  As to 22CF431 Count 1, Court withholds sentence and orders 10 years of probation with the following conditions: 1 year in jail, stayed pending further order of the Court.  No contact with T.W., their children, or their residence.  No contact with S.C., their family, or their residence.  No contact with J.P., their family, or their residence.  Pay restitution in the amounts of $4,435 + surcharges and $1,486.78 + surcharges.  Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.  4 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.  Remaining charges are dismissed and read-in.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Plea hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.
